episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features discussions on competitive eating, the complexity of the Archie language, advancements in computer technology, and Joni Mitchell's unique approach to her music career. The hosts explore quirky facts and anecdotes related to these topics, with guest presenter Olga Koch adding her comedic insights.

facts.fact: The world's best prawn cocktail eater practices his technique with budget meatballs.
In the Archi language of southern Russia, a single verb can have 1,502,839 possible forms.
If cars had improved at the same rate as computers since 1971, they would now be able to travel at nearly the speed of light.
On the same day that Joni Mitchell released a Greatest Hits album, she also released a Greatest Misses album.
